thread.title: What's for tea at Morton Colliery Cricket Club?
thread.title_full: What's for tea at Morton Colliery Cricket Club? - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: What's for tea at Morton Colliery Cricket Club?
text: Read more about the Great Cricket Tea Challenge Morton Colliery’s teas are made by Lesley Matthews, her daughter Rachel and Pat Vardy. Lesley’s husband Neil captains the second XI and their son Blair plays for the first XI. The Derbyshire League fixes a sum of £39 per team for teas, to which the club adhere. For all home games, Lesley makes two large cottage pies, using Derbyshire rare breed beef, that are always demolished. The players can also try a mixed salad; cheese and tomato pizza; bacon and sausage quiche; cheese and onion quiche; Derbyshire sausage rolls; potato wedges; and scrumptious pork pies from nearby Manor Farm. With such a spread on offer, visiting captains are strongly advised to field first For sandwiches, cut into large fingers, there are egg and cress, and succulent ham and cheese. All the meats are locally sourced and the eggs are from the club treasurer’s hens. The sweet selection includes mini strawberry Victoria sponge cakes; strawberry puff pastry slices; chocolate sponge; yo-yo cakes; lemon cupcakes; lemon drizzle; apple crumble, vanilla cheesecake; ice cream; and fruit from the nearby allotments. With such a spread on offer, visiting captains are strongly advised to field first.
